title: Weird Love Vol 2.
author: N/A
description: Collection of romance comics with non-traditional storylines about love and marriage, stories generally center on women engaging in actions independent of male control and/or other lurid/unsavory relations. Stories include Too Fat to Frug, Men You Shouldn't Marry, I was a Border Racket Girl!, A Monster's Kisses, etc....

title: Tales from the Crypt #23 - "Reflection of Death!"
author: Bill Gaines aka Grant Stone
description: Published by EC Comics, this series of short horror stories focus on the misfortune of those who act unethically or with poor intention. These end with sometimes greusome and gory deaths or unfortunate events.

title: Shock Suspenstories #15
author: Bill Gaines
artist: Jack Kamen, Wally Wood, Reed Crandall, George Evans
description: Collection of horror/suspense stories published by EC Comics, stories focus on crimes somewhat more disturbing than baseline bad versus good, and there is frequent obfuscation of good people with bad intent. Stories include Raw Deal, The Confidant, Slaughter!, For Cryin' Out Loud!, and Well Trained.

title: Shock Suspenstories #4
author: William M. Gaines, Al Feldstein
artist: Jack Davis, Joe Orlando, Jack Kamen, Wally Wood
comic code violations: A.3, A.6, A.7, C.MarriageandSex.2; C.MarriageandSex.4; C.MarriageandSex.6
description: Stories: Split Second (Lumberjack blinds young man after his wife falsely accuses him of assaulting her. Lumberjack is placed in a log by the other lumberjacks, and the blind man cuts him in half); Confession (A man is tortured by the police into admitting to a crime he didn't commit. A police officer actually commited the crime); Strictly Business (A man hires a wife for a three year marriage contract. He ends up being part of a group of robots planning to take over the Earth); Uppercut (A man who profits off of fights ends up getting a young fighter killed, is punished by another young fighter who gives him a chemical that will make him appear dead so that he is buried alive.)

title: The Green Lantern
author: Martin Nodell and Bill Finger
description: Introduction of Alan Scott as the Green Lantern, a superhero who fights evil with the power of a magic lantern from which he forges a ring powered by willpower.

title: Gold Digger
author: Joe Simon and Jack Kirby
artist: Joe Simon, Jack Kirby, Jerry Robinson, Mort Meskin, and Bill Draut
description: Young Romance #5 involves short stories focused on romance. Gold Digger, for instance, is one of the short stories involved. A woman, who was considered a Gold Digger, gets with a man who knows her intent. Both try to outsmart each other but fall in love with each other at the end.

title: Batman 1940 No.1
author: Bob Kane and Bill Goldfinger
artist: Bob Kane, Jerry Robinson, Sheldon Moldoff, and George Roussos
description: Batman is a DC Comics Superhero. Robin and Batman fight crime and one of Batman's known villains, the Joker, appears as well.

title: Eerie Comics 001
author: Bill DuBay, Christopher Taylor, David Lapham, Greg Potters
artist: Richard Corben, Jim Pavalec, Rafa Garres
description: Eerie Comics 001 involves short stories focused on horror. Some stories include "The Eyes of the Tiger," and "Dead Man's Tale."

title: Adventures Into the Unknown no. 38
author: N/A
artist: Ken Bald, Harry Lazarus, Paul Gattuso, Charles Nicholas, King Ward, Paul Cooper
description: Stories include & themes include: supernatural/horror-tinged stories from stories like "The Man who retured from Hades!" or "Witch Doctor's Revenge"

title: Alter Ego no. 10
author: N/A
description: Stories include & themes include: unpublished strips, fan magazines, parody pieces of art from stories like "Who created the silver age flash" or "Irritate the eye"

title: Moon, A Girl...Romance no. 9
author: N/A
description: Stories include & themes include: dramatized illicit romance and melodrama from stories like "I was a Flirt" or "Dear Diary..."

title: Tales of the Crypt #40
author: Al Feldstein
description: Collection of horror stories by EC Comics. Features gruseome tales of murder, supernatural revenge, punishment, and dark humor.

title: Weird Love Vol 1.
author: Craig Yoe
comic code violations: A.3; A.4; C.1; C.Costume.2; C.Costume.3;C.Costume.4; C.MarriageandSex.2; C.MarriageandSex.4; C.MarriageandSex.5; C.MarriageandSex.6
description: A collection of over the top love stories that are way out of left field. This comic has stories such as: I fell for a commie, Too fat for love, and Yes I was an escort girl.

artist: Jack Davis, Jack Kamen, Bernard Krigstein, Graham Ingles
comic code violations: A.2; A.6; A.8; B.3; B.4; B.5; C.MarriageandSex.2; C.MarriageandSex.6
description: A series of short, horror stories published by EC comics. Stories include Concerto For Violin And Werewolf, By The Dawn's Early Light, On Ice!, The Bath, and Hoodwinked!, all with the running theme of twisted justice.

title: Haunted Horror, Vol. 2: Comics Your Mother Warned You About!

description: A classic Golden Age anthology of eerie tales where ghosts, supernatural forces, and strange twists of fate drive suspenseful stories.

title: A Moon, A Girl... Romance no. 9

description: A melodramatic romance comic weaving stories of love, heartbreak, and betrayal, aimed at capturing the intensity of post-war relationships.

title: Young Romance
author: Joe Simon
description: Early romance comic portraying love, heartbreak, and marriage dilemmas, and also shows emotional drama and sensationalized relationships.

title: Action Comics #1
author: Jerry Siegel
description: First issue of the comic book series Action Comics. Published in 1938, it introduced Superman as the first major superhero, highlighting themes of justice, strength, and protecting the weak, alongside other stories of magic, crime, western, and adventure.

title: Super Duck Comics no. 1

description: Comic published by Archie Comics. A duck with superpowers brings justice to scamming magicians. Kidnapping is involved, as well as moderate violence, but nothing is very severe. (it is quite a silly comic)

description: Comic published by EC. Collection of 4 stories about various illegal schemes, 3 of which involve some sort of monetary stakes while 1 of them is about an infidelity scandal. 3 involve murder.
